River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision made by director Vincent Ward is the complete lack of subtitles for any of this movie's non-English dialogue. As a result, River Queen plays like an acid trip where you don't laugh at or freak out over what others are seeing; instead you watch "the best bits"

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is going to haunt and follow them into their lives as well.
For some people this movie was average at best. While others found this movie too be very scary, unpredictable and bloody.
The acting was great by most if not all of the actors though the one worst

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to score big time with martial arts aficionados has just about every martial arts technique and move that one would love to see in an action-packed flick, and it was executively acted/produced by none other than Bruce Lee’s own protege Dan Inosanto.
